sx.blah.discord.util

Class RequestBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • sx.blah.discord.util.RequestBuilder

  • public class RequestBuilder
extends Object
    This is a utility class to help create asynchronous and synchronous interactions with the discord api.
    This builder works on the following model:
    • The builder has one "active" action, which is the action currently being modified by these builder methods.
    • When either andThen(IRequestAction) or elseDo(IRequestAction) are called, the "active" action is then placed on a queue and is replaced by a new action to be modified.
    • After execute() is called, the builder then goes down the queue of actions. For each action, it will wait for an event before and/or after its main RequestBuilder.IRequestAction is executed. Once the main RequestBuilder.IRequestAction is executed, it will handle then call the action created by elseDo(IRequestAction) if an exception was encountered and call the correct exception handler, otherwise it'll then repeat this process on the next action as provided by the andThen(IRequestAction) method.

    • Nested Class Summary

      static interface  RequestBuilder.IRequestAction
      This represents an action done for a request.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RequestBuilder

        public RequestBuilder(IDiscordClient client)

    • Method Detail

      • shouldBufferRequests

        public RequestBuilder shouldBufferRequests(boolean shouldBuffer)
        Determines whether this request should be buffered for rate limits. This is false by default.
        Parameters:
        shouldBuffer - If true, rate limits will be handled automatically, if false, RateLimitExceptions have to be handled manually.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.
        See Also:
        RequestBuffer

      • shouldFailOnException

        public RequestBuilder shouldFailOnException(boolean shouldFail)
        Determines whether this request should fail when an exception is encountered. It is essentially the same as RequestBuilder.IRequestAction.execute() returning false. This is true by default.
        Parameters:
        shouldFail - If true, the request will be cancelled on an exception, if false the request will continue on an exception.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.

      • setAsync

        public RequestBuilder setAsync(boolean isAsync)
        Determines whether or not this request should be asynchronous. This is false by default.
        Parameters:
        isAsync - If true, the request will be executed on a separate thread, if false the request will be executed on the current thread.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.

      • doAction

        public RequestBuilder doAction(RequestBuilder.IRequestAction action)
        This sets the currently "active" action's actual action.
        Parameters:
        action - The action to run.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.

      • doActionAfter

        public <T extends Event> RequestBuilder doActionAfter(Predicate<T> eventFilter)
        This makes the currently active action execute AFTER the specified event filter is passed.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of event to wait for.
        Parameters:
        eventFilter - The event filter, it should return true when the action should proceed.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.

      • doActionAfter

        public <T extends Event> RequestBuilder doActionAfter(Predicate<T> eventFilter,
                                                      long time)
        This makes the currently active action execute AFTER the specified event filter is passed.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of event to wait for.
        Parameters:
        eventFilter - The event filter, it should return true when the action should proceed.
        time - The timeout, in milliseconds. After this amount of time is reached, the thread is notified regardless of whether the event fired.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.

      • doActionAfter

        public <T extends Event> RequestBuilder doActionAfter(Predicate<T> eventFilter,
                                                      long time,
                                                      TimeUnit unit)
        This makes the currently active action execute AFTER the specified event filter is passed.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of event to wait for.
        Parameters:
        eventFilter - The event filter, it should return true when the action should proceed.
        time - The timeout. After this amount of time is reached, the thread is notified regardless of whether the event fired.
        unit - The unit for the time parameter.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of event to wait for.
        Parameters:
        eventFilter - The event filter, it should return true when the action should proceed.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.

      • onDiscordError

        public RequestBuilder onDiscordError(Consumer<DiscordException> exceptionConsumer)
        This creates a handler for when DiscordExceptions occur. By default the handler just logs the exception.
        Parameters:
        exceptionConsumer - The exception handler.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.

      • onRatelimitError

        Parameters:
        exceptionConsumer - The exception handler.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.

        Returns:

      • onGeneralError

        public RequestBuilder onGeneralError(Consumer<Exception> exceptionConsumer)
        This creates a handler for when external Exceptions occur. By default the handler just logs the exception.
        Parameters:
        exceptionConsumer - The exception handler.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.

      • onTimeout

        public RequestBuilder onTimeout(Procedure timeoutProcedure)
        This creates a handler for when the current action times out on doActionBefore or doActionAfter
        Parameters:
        timeoutProcedure - The timeout handler.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.

      • andThen

        public RequestBuilder andThen(RequestBuilder.IRequestAction action)
        This creates a new active action which will be executed after the current one succeeds.
        Parameters:
        action - The action to run.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.

      • elseDo

        public RequestBuilder elseDo(RequestBuilder.IRequestAction action)
        This creates a new active action which will be executed after the current one succeeds. Note: this new action CANNOT have a following action, the following action would occur after the current one succeeds.
        Parameters:
        action - The action to run.
        Returns:
        The builder instance.

      • build

        public void build()
        Same as execute() since apparently there's supposed to be a build method in every builder class.

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Executes the built request.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels the request.

      • isCancelled

        public boolean isCancelled()
        Gets whether or not this request has been cancelled.
        Returns:
        True if cancelled, false if otherwise.

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Gets whether or not this request is still in the process of executing.
        Returns:
        True if cancelled or finished, false if otherwise.
